info.title: Npcf_PolicyAuthorization Service API
info.description: This is the Policy Authorization Service

externalDocs.description: 3GPP TS 29.514 V15.3.0; 5G System; Policy Authorization Service;Stage 3.

apiRoot.description: apiRoot as defined in subclause 4.4 of 3GPP TS 29.501

post.summary: Creates a new Individual Application Session Context resource

requestBody.description: Contains the information for the creation the resource

Location.description: Contains the URI of the created individual application session context resource, according to the structure: {apiRoot}/npcf-policyauthorization/v1/app-sessions/{appSessionId} or the URI of the created events subscription sub-resource, according to the structure: {apiRoot}/npcf-policyauthorization/v1/app-sessions/{appSessionId}/events-subscription}

303.description: See Other. The result of the HTTP POST request would be equivalent to the existing Application Session Context. The HTTP response shall contain a Location header field set to the URI of the existing individual Application Session Context resource

Retry-After.description: Indicates the time the AF has to wait before making a new request. It can be a non-negative integer (decimal number) indicating the number of seconds the AF has to wait before making a new request or an HTTP-date after which the AF can retry a new request.

requestBody.description: Request of the termination of the Individual Application Session Context

204.description: The receipt of the notification is acknowledged.

requestBody.description: Notification of an event occurrence in the PCF.

204.description: The receipt of the notification is acknowledged

get.summary: Reads an existing Individual Application Session Context

200.description: A representation of the resource is returned.

patch.summary: Modifies an existing Individual Application Session Context

200.description: successful modification of the resource and a representation of that resource is returned

Retry-After.description: Indicates the time the AF has to wait before making a new request. It can be a non-negative integer (decimal number) indicating the number of seconds the AF has to wait before making a new request or an HTTP-date after which the AF can retry a new request.

requestBody.description: Notification of an event occurrence in the PCF.

204.description: The receipt of the notification is acknowledged

post.summary: Deletes an existing Individual Application Session Context

parameters.name: appSessionId
parameters.description: string identifying the Individual Application Session Context resource

requestBody.description: deletion of the Individual Application Session Context resource, req notification

200.description: The deletion of the resource is confirmed and a resource is returned

204.description: The deletion is confirmed without returning additional data.

put.summary: creates or modifies an Events Subscription subresource

parameters.name: appSessionId
parameters.description: string identifying the Events Subscription resource

requestBody.description: Creation or modification of an Events Subscription resource.

200.description: The modification of the of the Events Subscription resource is confirmed its representation is returned.

201.description: The creation of the Events Subscription resource is confirmed and its representation is returned.

Location.description: Contains the URI of the created Events Subscription resource, according to the structure: {apiRoot}/npcf-policyauthorization/v1/app-sessions/{appSessionId}/events-subscription}

204.description: The modification of the Events Subscription subresource is confirmed without returning additional data.

requestBody.description: Contains the information for the notification of an event occurrence in the PCF.

204.description: The receipt of the notification is acknowledged.

parameters.name: appSessionId
parameters.description: string identifying the Individual Application Session Context resource

204.description: The deletion of the of the Events Subscription sub-resource is confirmed without returning additional data.

AppSessionContext.description: Represents an Individual Application Session Context resource.

AppSessionContextReqData.description: Identifies the service requirements of an Individual Application Session Context.

AppSessionContextRespData.description: Describes the authorization data of an Individual Application Session Context created by the PCF.

AppSessionContextUpdateData.description: Identifies the modifications to an Individual Application Session Context and may include the modifications to the sub-resource Events Subscription.

EventsSubscReqData.description: Identifies the events the application subscribes to.

EventsSubscReqDataRm.description: this data type is defined in the same way as the EventsSubscReqData data type, but with the OpenAPI nullable property set to true.

MediaComponentRm.description: This data type is defined in the same way as the MediaComponent data type, but with the OpenAPI nullable property set to true

MediaSubComponentRm.description: This data type is defined in the same way as the MediaSubComponent data type, but with the OpenAPI nullable property set to true. Removable attributes marBwDland marBwUl are defined with the corresponding removable data type.

EventsNotification.description: describes the notification of a matched event

AfEventSubscription.description: describes the event information delivered in the subscription

AfEventNotification.description: describes the event information delivered in the notification

TerminationInfo.description: indicates the cause for requesting the deletion of the Individual Application Session Context resource

AfRoutingRequirement.description: describes the event information delivered in the subscription

SpatialValidity.description: describes explicitly the route to an Application location

SpatialValidityRm.description: this data type is defined in the same way as the SpatialValidity data type, but with the OpenAPI nullable property set to true

AfRoutingRequirementRm.description: this data type is defined in the same way as the AfRoutingRequirement data type, but with the OpenAPI nullable property set to true and the spVal and tempVals attributes defined as removable.

AnGwAddress.description: describes the address of the access network gateway control node

ResourcesAllocationInfo.description: describes the status of the PCC rule(s) related to certain media components.

TemporalValidity.description: Indicates the time interval(s) during which the AF request is to be applied

QosNotificationControlInfo.description: Indicates whether the QoS targets for a GRB flow are not  guaranteed or guaranteed again

AspId.description: Contains an identity of an application service provider.

ContentVersion.description: Represents the content version of some content.

FlowDescription.description: Defines a packet filter of an IP flow.

SponId.description: Contains an identity of a sponsor.

TosTrafficClass.description: 2-octet string, where each octet is encoded in hexadecimal representation. The first octet contains the IPv4 Type-of-Service or the IPv6 Traffic-Class field and the second octet contains the ToS/Traffic Class mask field.

TosTrafficClassRm.description: this data type is defined in the same way as the TosTrafficClass data type, but with the OpenAPI nullable property set to true

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It should not change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem.

status.description: The HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

cause.description: A machine-readable application error cause specific to this occurrence of the problem. This IE should be present and provide application-related error information, if available.

invalidParams.description: Description of invalid parameters, for a request rejected due to invalid parameters.

Uri.description: string providing an URI formatted according to IETF RFC 3986.

param.description: Attribute's name encoded as a JSON Pointer, or header's name.

reason.description: A human-readable reason, e.g. "must be a positive integer".

DateTime.description: string with format "date-time" as defined in OpenAPI.

Ipv4Addr.description: string identifying a Ipv4 address formatted in the "dotted decimal" notation as defined in IETF RFC 1166.

Ipv6Addr.description: string identifying a Ipv6 address formatted according to clause 4 in IETF RFC 5952. The mixed Ipv4 Ipv6 notation according to clause 5 of IETF RFC 5952 shall not be used.

SupportedFeatures.description: A string used to indicate the features supported by an API that is used as defined in subclause 6.6 in 3GPP TS 29.500 [1]. The string shall contain a bitmask indicating supported features in hexadecimal representation. Each character in the string shall take a value of "0" to "9" or "A" to "F" and shall represent the support of 4 features as described in table 5.2.2-3. The most significant character representing the highest-numbered features shall appear first in the string, and the character representing features 1 to 4 shall appear last in the string. The list of features and their numbering (starting with 1) are defined separately for each API. Possible features for traffic influencing are Notification_websocket(1), Notification_test_event(2)

Dnai.description: Identifies the location of the application.

DurationSec.description: Unsigned integer identifying a period of time in units of seconds.

Volume.description: Unsigned integer identifying a volume in units of bytes.

anyOf.description: This string provides forward-compatibility with future extensions to the enumeration but is not used to encode content defined in the present version of this API.

FlowDirection.description: Possible values are - DOWNLINK: The corresponding filter applies for traffic to the UE. - UPLINK: The corresponding filter applies for traffic from the UE. - BIDIRECTIONAL: The corresponding filter applies for traffic both to and from the UE. - UNSPECIFIED: The corresponding filter applies for traffic to the UE (downlink), but has no specific direction declared. The service data flow detection shall apply the filter for uplink traffic as if the filter was bidirectional. The PCF shall not use the value UNSPECIFIED in filters created by the network in NW-initiated procedures. The PCF shall only include the value UNSPECIFIED in filters in UE-initiated procedures if the same value is received from the SMF.

anyOf.description: This string provides forward-compatibility with future extensions to the enumeration but is not used to encode content defined in the present version of this API.

DnaiChangeType.description: Possible values are - EARLY: Early notification of UP path reconfiguration. - EARLY_LATE: Early and late notification of UP path reconfiguration. This value shall only be present in the subscription to the DNAI change event. - LATE: Late notification of UP path reconfiguration.

notifCorreId.description: It is used to set the value of Notification Correlation ID in the notification sent by the SMF.

BdtReferenceId.description: string identifying a BDT Reference ID as defined in subclause 5.3.3 of 3GPP TS 29.154.

DurationSecRm.description: Unsigned integer identifying a period of time in units of seconds with "nullable=true" property.

VolumeRm.description: Unsigned integer identifying a volume in units of bytes with "nullable=true" property.
